introduction.title: The Path to Implementation
introduction.paragraph1: After I had the basic idea - Spain could really become my new home - and the advantages I saw in it outweighed my initial fears, it was time to make a real plan. Dreams alone aren't enough. I wanted to understand: Is this even feasible? What requirements do I need to meet? And what could a realistic timeline look like?
introduction.paragraph2: Luckily, the internet is full of information - and of course, I'm not the first German to consider emigrating to Spain. Idealista became a real constant companion of my research. For those who don't know: Idealista is not only the largest real estate platform in Spain (comparable to Immoscout24 in Germany), but also a real treasure trove of information.
introduction.paragraph3: Right from the start, four main topics crystallized for me:

conclusion.title: Conclusion of my research
conclusion.intro: At the end of my research, I was wiser - and honestly more motivated too. I knew:

residenceRights.title: ✅ Residence Rights
residenceRights.description: As a German, relatively uncomplicated, but with obligations after 3 months or 183 days.

work.title: ✅ Work
work.description: Remote from Germany = financially more attractive, but with tax pitfalls.

taxes.title: ✅ Taxes
taxes.description: Complex, regionally different, you need good advice.

livingCosts.title: ✅ Cost of Living
livingCosts.description: At first glance cheap, but realistically only in relation to Spanish salaries.

bonus.title: Bonus: Gluten-Free Food
bonus.description: Obviously easier and more varied than in Germany, both in supermarkets and restaurants.
